summary: This document is an email chain from June 2020 among law enforcement personnel regarding the Epstein investigation, specifically concerning the status of subpoena returns sent to various state divisions of corporations (Albany, USVI, Delaware) in 2019. It shows ongoing investigative follow-up work.

events.title: Subpoena to Albany Division of Corporations
events.description: A subpoena was served on the Albany Division of Corporations as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: First Subpoena to USVI Corporations and Trademarks
events.description: A subpoena was served on the US Virgin Islands Corporations and Trademarks division.

events.title: Second Subpoena to USVI Corporations and Trademarks
events.description: A second subpoena was served on the US Virgin Islands Corporations and Trademarks division.

events.title: Subpoena to Delaware Division of Corporations
events.description: A subpoena was served on the State of Delaware, Division of Corporations.

keyFacts: The email chain is a 2020 follow-up regarding subpoenas served in 2019 on state corporate divisions in Albany, USVI, and Delaware as part of the Epstein investigation.
The correspondence involves a Senior Financial Investigator from 'Squad C-40 (FAST)' and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York.
The investigators are seeking returns for subpoenas related to entities possibly including 'LSJ LLC' and 'NAUTILUS'.
The emails indicate the use of a USAFX file-sharing portal for transferring large documents and show coordination with a contractor.
